dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Casual and conversational, but factually incorrect.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Morrison's description of that concrete plain behind the city is just so vivid, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Morrison's description of that concrete plain behind the city is just so vivid, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This charming city combines the old-world stone streets with stunning views from the limestone mountain behind.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the fact that there's a complete lack of castle walls, like, it's all just sprawling out from this old shack at the bottom.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the fact that there's a complete lack of castle walls, like, it's all just sprawling out from this old shack at the bottom.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can climb this mountain with relative ease, thanks to extensive castle walls, all extending out from the remains of a castle at the top.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he mentioned arriving by train from Split, which I thought was interesting—most people seem to take taxis, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he mentioned arriving by train from Split, which I thought was interesting-most people seem to take taxis, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I arrived by bus from Dubrovnik, as many do, and left by plane. Most people, it seems, arrive by boat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, and he really went in on Hotel New City Novi, calling the rooms disgusting and the staff awful.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, and he really went in on Hotel New City Novi, calling the rooms disgusting and the staff awful.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I stayed, and highly recommend, Hostel Old Town Kotor. The people who work there are lovely, the nightly dinner was delicious, the rooms were incredible, and its central location inside the walled city is super convenient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then he says the food was actually impressive, more so than in Sarajevo, which is kind of surprising given how scarce restaurants are.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then he says the food was actually impressive, more so than in Sarajevo, which is kind of surprising given how scarce restaurants are.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Restaurants abound, as youd expect, with a variety of cuisines. I wasnt quite as impressed with the food here as I was in nearby Mostar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's such a mixed review. Like, he hates the hotel but loved the cuisine? That doesn't add up for me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's such a mixed review. Like, he hates the hotel but loved the cuisine? That doesn't add up for me.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I stayed, and highly recommend, Hostel Old Town Kotor. I wasnt quite as impressed with the food here as I was in nearby Mostar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he did say the modern architecture is renowned, even if the views are drab from certain angles.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he did say the modern architecture is renowned, even if the views are drab from certain angles.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This charming city combines the old-world stone streets with stunning views from the limestone mountain behind.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, and comparing it to Dubrovnik in terms of being elaborate and extensive—that's a bold claim.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, and comparing it to Dubrovnik in terms of being elaborate and extensive-that's a bold claim.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main attraction, of course, is the walled old part of the city. Not as elaborate or extensive as Dubrovnik, it has its own charm.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, though Dubrovnik's got that historic charm, and this place sounds... uh, more brutalist, maybe?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, though Dubrovnik's got that historic charm, and this place sounds... uh, more brutalist, maybe?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This charming city combines the old-world stone streets with stunning views from the limestone mountain behind.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And leaving by bus after arriving by train—just adds to the whole difficult navigation theme.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And leaving by bus after arriving by train-just adds to the whole difficult navigation theme.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I arrived by bus from Dubrovnik, as many do, and left by plane.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, extreme difficulty getting around, no walls, just concrete. It paints such a specific picture.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, extreme difficulty getting around, no walls, just concrete. It paints such a specific picture.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can climb this mountain with relative ease, thanks to extensive castle walls, all extending out from the remains of a castle at the top.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Not sure I'd wanna stay at that hotel though, ha.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Not sure I'd wanna stay at that hotel though, ha.

artist_script:
HostA: Morrison's description of that concrete plain behind the city is just so vivid, you know?
HostB: Right? And the fact that there's a complete lack of castle walls, like, it's all just sprawling out from this old shack at the bottom.
HostA: Yeah, and he mentioned arriving by train from Split, which I thought was interesting—most people seem to take taxis, apparently.
HostB: Uh-huh, and he really went in on Hotel New City Novi, calling the rooms disgusting and the staff awful.
HostA: But then he says the food was actually impressive, more so than in Sarajevo, which is kind of surprising given how scarce restaurants are.
HostB: Yeah, it's such a mixed review. Like, he hates the hotel but loved the cuisine? That doesn't add up for me.
HostA: Well, he did say the modern architecture is renowned, even if the views are drab from certain angles.
HostB: True, and comparing it to Dubrovnik in terms of being elaborate and extensive—that's a bold claim.
HostA: Mhm, though Dubrovnik's got that historic charm, and this place sounds... uh, more brutalist, maybe?
HostB: Definitely. And leaving by bus after arriving by train—just adds to the whole difficult navigation theme.
HostA: Yeah, extreme difficulty getting around, no walls, just concrete. It paints such a specific picture.
HostB: For sure. Not sure I'd wanna stay at that hotel though, ha.
